name: Upright Row, SZ-bar
how_to_perform:
1. Hold an SZ-bar with a pronated grip ( palms facing away from your body) and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.

2. Keeping your back straight and core engaged, lift the bar up to chest height by bending at the elbows and keeping your upper arms still. Focus on squeezing your shoulder muscles at the top of the movement.

3. Lower the bar down to the starting position in a controlled manner, keeping your elbows close to your body.

4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on using your shoulders and back muscles to lift the bar.

5. Rest when finished.
short_summary: The upright row is an upper body exercise that targets the trapezius, rhomboids, and other shoulder muscles
